page.title: 02ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: Years back, in the 1300's {Ashdown {Forest}used to be a Royal Game Park.The whole area,{6,400 acres}in all were surrounded by a fence called a{Pole.}The Pole fence was set on one of the banks of a ditch, the ditch being on the inside of the park. This was a clever way of increasing the population of the deer park as the wild deer could jump the fence into the park but could not clear the ditch and the fence to escape.In the{1690's} parts of the forest were sold off to private landowners so the area today is much reduced. However, it is still a very large area that is much used by many people for picnicking,{horse {riding,}and walking. There is a { {Forest Centre}that manages the Forest and protects it against the many modern dangers of fire, pollution and over-use by the many visitors.
